entries.title: Adventure with Muk
entries.altText: Adventure with Muk

entries: An adventure activity book for players of all levels

entries.name: In Support of Extra Life
entries: Created & Illustrated by Emi Tanji
Adventure & Design Genius by Adam Lee and Chris Lindsay
Special Thanks to Bart Carroll

entries.title: Hello! I'm Muk the (bravest) Goblin
entries.altText: Hello! I'm Muk the (bravest) Goblin. Jet black hair that kinda smells. But a good stink! Super big ears for super good hearing. Goblins have yellow or orange skin. My nos is like a kitty. A fierce kitty. Who needs boots? I need to SNEAK! Level: 3. Specialties: Super sneaky. Great at climbing, and I can talk to animals!

entries.title: What does {@b your} adventurer look like?
entries.altText: Your Name. What does your adventurer look like?

entries.title: Let me introduce you to my best friend and companion, {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM}!
entries.altText: Let me introduce you to my best friend and companion, Birdsquirrel! Part bird, part squirrel, all awesome. Birdsquirrel was made with magic by a nitty wizard! Uh oh.

entries.title: Draw your magical creature combo!
entries.altText: Draw your magical creature combo! Owl + Bear = Owlbear. Spider + Frog = Spiderfrog. Rhino + Shark = Rhinoshark.

entries.title: There are some crazy monsters out there.
entries.altText: Beholder: This guy has eleven eyes! Grick: Watch out for its beak! Grey Slaad: Tastes nothing like a salad! Yuck! There are some crazy monsters out there. You better stick with us!

entries.title: How to draw a...
entries.altText: How to draw a... Goblin (me!), Flumph, Grung. Now you try!

entries.title: Of we're going adventuring, we should always be prepared!
entries.altText: Of we're going adventuring, we should always be prepared! This is my super cool shield. I made it myself.

entries.title: What does your shield look like?
entries.altText: What does your shield look like? Here are some different shapes to choose from. Birdsquirrel is ready for action!

entries.title: Time for adventure!
entries.altText: Time for adventure! Hey! You can have my map. I already have the best treasure. The shiniest rock. My friend slurpy. Snowy hills. Beware giants. Treasure? Big water. Dummy goblins. Gob-town. Dankwood.

entries.title: Create a map of your own!
entries.altText: Create a map of your own!

entries.title: What swims under Muk's boat?
entries.altText: What swims under Muk's boat?

entries.title: Which vine should Muk climb to get to safety?
entries.altText: Which vine should Muk climb to get to safety? Froghemoth. Safety. Meenlock.

entries.title: Wow! Muk found a {@item Bag of Tricks}
entries.altText: Wow! Muk found a Bag of Tricks. What did you pull from the Bag of Tricks?

entries: This is a magical bag that can summon a furry friend to aide you on your adventure!
Roll {@dice 2d6|two, 6-sided dice} and use the charts below to see what kind of animal comes out and its personality!

items: ADVENTURE
BEHOLDER
BUGBEAR
BULETTE
BULLYWUG
DRAGON
DROW
ELF
FLUMPH
GNOLL
GOBLIN
HERO
KENKU
MUK
OWLBEAR
TROLL

entries.title: {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} can't read so good... can you please help?
entries.altText: Birdsquirrel can't read so good... can you please help?

entries.title: Uh oh... Looks like we've run into some... friends?
entries.altText: Uh oh... Looks like we've run into some... friends? Bugbears are a type of goblinoid, too. They a super big... like, 7 feet tall! They like to boss us goblins around, all the time!

entries.title: Charisma Check!
entries.altText: Charisma Check! Help Muk choose just the right words to get past the bugbear guards!

items.name: Instructions
entries: Once you've finished choosing your words, flip to the next page and fill in the blanks in the order as it's listed. Read Muk's speech out loud and decide if he charms his way past the Bugbears!

items.name: Adjective:
entries: A word that {@i describes} something or someone

items.name: Adverb:
entries: A verb (action) usually ending in "ly"

items.name: Noun:
entries: A person, place or thing

items.name: Plural Noun:
entries: Multiple persons, places or things

items.name: Verb:
entries: Ab action, or something someone does
{@footnote __________________|EXCLAMATION} {@footnote __________________|ADJECTIVE} Guards!
Isn't it a {@footnote __________________|ADJECTIVE} {@footnote __________________|TIME OF DAY}?
My name is Muk, the {@footnote __________________|ADJECTIVE}!
You may have heard of me, as my {@footnote __________________|PLURAL NOUN} are quite well-known!
The songs of my victory over the {@footnote __________________|NUMBER} {@footnote __________________|SCARY NOUN} is all true!
Your {@footnote __________________|ADJECTIVE} leader, {@footnote __________________|NAME OF PERSON IN ROOM} gave me permission to pass.
But! If you try to give us any {@footnote __________________|NOUN}, my sidekick here will {@footnote __________________|VERB} the both of you!
Beware, {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} fights quite {@footnote __________________|ADVERB}!

entries.title: Help Muk find {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} before the skeletons do!
entries.altText: Help Muk find Birdsquirrel before the skeletons do!

entries.title: The dwarves have lost all their hair!
entries.altText: The dwarves have lost all their hair! Draw back the beards/eyebrows/hair on these four brave dwarven folk! Like me!

entries.title: Even the bravest goblin gets scared!
entries.altText: Even the bravest goblin gets scared! Draw the two heads on the demogorgon. I can't look!

entries.title: Is this the Treasure?
entries.altText: Is this the Treasure?

entries.title: Decode the secret scroll from the treasure chest!
entries.altText: Decode the secret scroll from the treasure chest! The End! Thank you for adventuring with us!

entries.title: Answers
entries.altText: Which vine should Muk climb to get to safety? Climb Vine number 3! Secret Scroll: It is not what we have...but who we have.

entries.title: If you've enjoyed adventuring with Muk, there's more ahead! Read on to learn more about Muk, his fellow goblins and adventures {@u you} can partake in!
entries.altText: If you've enjoyed adventuring with Muk, there's more ahead! Read on to learn more about Muk, his fellow goblins and adventures you can partake in!

data.name: Muk and Friends
entries: Welcome to the world of Muk, a plucky little goblin and his loyal companion, {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM}. They live in Gob-Town, deep within Dankwood Forest along with a bunch of their goblin-y friends digging up grubs, making mud houses, and picking edible nuts, roots, and berries for their goblin feasts.
But Dankwood is a magical place populated by monsters and ancient ruins. Muk has had many adventures exploring his home and has met many creatures—some friendly and some very grumpy.

Muk's friend, the eccentric gnome wizard, Doonwaggle who created {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM}, has all kinds of things for Muk to do within the Dankwood. Doonwaggle is always coming up with new experiments and needs ingredients for them which keeps Muk and his friends busy.

entries.name: How to Play!
entries: This adventure booklet is designed for an adult dungeon master to introduce kids to role-playing and storytelling in a {@style Dungeons & Dragons|dnd-font} adventure.

The story hooks are basic and require no maps. All you need are some dice, pencils, paper, and your imaginations. Each adventure hook has a basic problem to solve followed by some questions that you can ask your players to answer about the story. In this adventure, you are going to co-create the story with your players to get them comfortable with using their imaginations to create the world and tell stories within it. These questions are suggestions to get the imagination expanded, so feel free to add your own questions and expand on them. Often, new players don't know that they can think of {@b anything} that their imagination can conjure up, so it can take some prompting from the dungeon master to break down the boundaries of what is possible and get to a space where the magic and wonder of the fantasy world truly comes alive.

entries.name: The Heroes
entries: This adventure activity book has its own cast of characters for your players to use as their adventurers. Every hero has a backstory that you can tell your player about to give them an idea of what their character is like, or you can have your players invent a completely new backstory on their own.

entries.name: You Like Adventure Hooks?
entries: Here's a list of fun ideas that Muk and friends can encounter in the Dankwood. Use them to spawn adventures!
Roll a {@dice d8}:

rows: A dryad's silver acorn (I bet she would love it back!)
A unicorn's magical horn (Is something looking for it?)
A golden whistle (What does blowing the whistle do?)
A figurine of a golden bird (Does it come to life?)
The long-lost Gob-Stick (Sacred to all goblins!)
A treasure map! (Where does it lead? What's the treasure?)
A lost otter. (Was its memory erased by an evil hag's spell?)
A skull. (Does it ask to find the rest of its bones?)

entries.name: Muk and Birdsquirrel
entries: Muk and {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} are an inseparable team of adventurers. Together they love to explore and make friends within the forest. They love to investigate places that the other goblins are afraid of in hopes of finding magical items for the gnome wizard, Doonwaggle.

entries.name: Ungo
entries: Ungo was once the fiercest of goblin fighters who was rumored to have defeated many orcs. He has since renounced the ways of violence and now lives in a cave, content to wander the Dankwood, talking to the trees and sitting by streams where he watches the small, silvery fish swim in its waters. He knows the Dankwood better than any goblin around and has much wisdom and kindness in his heart.

entries.name: Wam and Rikruk
entries: Wam is a tough warrior who has a heart of gold. She is older than Muk and has taught him about surviving in the Dankwood. Several seasons ago, she found a baby goblin abandoned in the woods who she named Rikruk. Wam believes that Rikruk was given to her by the goblin gods to raise into a great goblin chief.

entries.name: Lord Fishbone
entries: Lord Fishbone was once known as Guk. Guk had always dreamed of the Big City that was rumored to be outside the Dankwood but no goblin had ever dared to go there. One day, Guk disappeared and rumor had it that he had finally gone to find the Big City. Guk came back years later as Lord Fishbone, dressed in human clothes and sporting an elegant moustache. Lord Fishbone is full of stories about all kinds strange and wonderful adventures that they had while in the human city. Lord Fishbone is courageous, full of life, and a dashing and daring adventurer.

entries.name: NPCs
entries: The following NPCs are for use in your game. Feel free to have them appear to help or hinder the characters as they go on their adventures. They can have information the party needs to solve a problem or they can help defeat a monster or heal a wounded adventurer.

entries.name: The Wizard Doonwaggle
entries: Doonwaggle is an eccentric gnome wizard who dabbles in the natural magic of the Dankwood which he uses to create hybrid creatures and mechanical toys.

entries.name: Dankwood Elders
entries: The Dankwood elders are three tribe members who are elected to guide the goblins of Dankwood. Gribble is a shaman, Gorm is a warrior, and Ginst is an artisan.

entries.name: Grubbah the Bugbear
entries: Grubbah is a bugbear who is the boss of all bugbears. She is strong, fierce, and always hungry so if you want to be her friend, food is the best way.

entries.name: Slurpy
entries: Slurpy is Muk's goblin friend who lives near the Big Water. He loves treasure hunting and knows of many secret places. His most prized possession is his Shiniest Rock, which he cleverly won from a silly, human adventurer named Greg.

entries.name: Adventure Ideas
entries: Every adventure has a solution that can be attained without resorting to combat, and the questions are designed to give your players some ingredients that may jog ideas as to how problems can be solved. There are many possible paths as to how each story can be told, so unlock the mind and let your imaginations lead the way!

entries.name: The Great Kroom
entries: There's a rumbling in woods and Ungo knows that it's the return of the {@creature Great Kroom, Purple Worm|AWM|Great Kroom, a purple worm} that digs enormous tunnels under Dankwood. The problem is that Ungo has forgotten what the goblins did to shoo him away the last time the Great Kroom was here. If the Great Kroom keeps digging, the whole of Gob-Town could fall into one of its tunnels!

entries.name: Questions to ask:
items: How do you think they got rid of the Great Kroom? Did they confuse him? Was it a magical spell?
Maybe ask the wizard Doonwaggle to see what he thinks!
What do purple worms like? What do they hate?

entries.name: The Hungry Otyugh
entries: Nobody likes the {@creature Hangry Otyugh|AWM|otyugh} because he's stinky and makes awful sounds. He may be very grumpy but Muk knows that it's only because he's hungry. The problem is that everything an {@creature Hangry Otyugh|AWM|otyugh} eats is really gross and he's coming closer to Gob-Town looking for more food.

entries.name: Questions to ask:
items: How can Muk help this poor, disagreeable monster?
What are some of the gross things that otyughs eat and where do you find them?
Is there a way to make the otyugh less stinky?

entries.name: Birdsquirrel's Journey
entries: By all accounts, {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} was created by the nutty wizard, Doonwaggle. But {@creature Birdsquirrel|AWM} now takes Muk on a quest deep into the woods to find a family of birdsquirrels. The only problem is that they have been captured by a {@creature Dankwood Hag|AWM|wicked hag} who wishes to use these unique and magical creatures in her latest soup!

entries.name: Questions to ask:
items: What other the other ingredients that are going in the hag's soup?
Why is the hag making the soup?
Is she grumpy? Or does she have a soft spot?
Does she have any pets?
Is she lonely?

entries.name: Getting Knocked Koo-Koo
entries: Most of the encounters in the Dankwood are designed to be solved without combat. But should a goblin get in a scuffle and lose all their hit points, have them be knocked out and wake up in an even more difficult situation. For example: if Muk loses a fight with a bugbear, he could wake up in a hag's cauldron and have to talk his way out of becoming part of a potion. Or, when escaping from a gang of nasty gobbos he slips and falls out of a tree, have him wake up, trussed like a turkey, in the grumpy gobbo camp.

entries.name: Doonwaggle's Contraption
entries: Doonwaggle needs three things for his latest magical experiment and he would like Muk and his friends to get them for him.

entries.name: The items are:
items: A pearl from a freshwater clam that live only in the waters within the Crystal Cave and which are guarded by a group of {@creature Crystal Cave Merfolk|AWM|merfolk}.
A golden nut from the sacred Boontu tree which is rumored to be filled with {@creature Boontu Monkey|AWM|grumpy monkeys}.
A feather from {@creature Saleeth the Couatl|AWM|Saleeth}, the gentle couatl who dwells in a ruined temple, high up on a hill within the forest.

entries: Once Doonwaggle gets his materials, he says that this contraption will be his finest creation to date!

entries.name: Questions to ask:
items: What do the {@creature Crystal Cave Merfolk|AWM|merfolk} want for their pearl? A song? A gemstone?
How do you get the nut without disturbing the {@creature Boontu Monkey|AWM|grumpy monkeys}?
What does {@creature Saleeth the Couatl|AWM|Saleeth} want for her feather?
What does Doonwaggle's contraption do once it's built?

entries.name: The Big Water Slurpent
entries: The Big Water is a place that few goblins go. The elders say that a great wizard's tower once stood on an island in the middle of the Big Water. The wizard created a giant monster to swim around the island to guard all the treasures in the tower. Legend has it that one day, long ago, the wizard cast a forbidden spell and the whole tower sunk into the lake, all of its treasures going with it.
The Big Water is a strange and magical place where few ever go, but Lord Fishbone says that if someone could swim underwater and get into the tower, they could see if there's treasure there.

entries.name: Questions to ask:
items: How far down under the water is the tower?
What are some rumors about what the treasure within the tower is?
How do you get by the {@creature Big Water Slurpent|AWM}? Does it like to eat goblins? Can you shrink it by using magic?
Is there a magical potion made of forest plants that can allow Muk and his pals to breathe underwater?

entries.name: Dealing with Dummy Goblins
entries: The {@creature Dum-Dum Goblin|AWM|Dum-Dum tribe of goblins} lives far enough away that they don't cause too much trouble, but just this morning, Wam discovered that some Dum-Dums had snuck into camp and stole Rikruk's favorite toy—a two-headed snake rattle. She knows it was them because Wam is an expert tracker and she discovered their footprints.
The Dum-Dums aren't all bad and maybe there's a good reason why they took the rattle. It's going to be hard to figure out how to get it back without a fight breaking out.

entries.name: Questions to ask:
items: Why did the Dum-Dums take the rattle?
Is the rattle magical?
Where is the rattle hidden?
How can Muk get the rattle without starting a fight?

entries.name: The Dwarf King
entries: Just as you get to the Snowy Hills, there's a cave that many goblins are told about when they are wee goblets. This cave is called the Giant's Cave as it is rumored to be the home to a {@creature Hill Giant, Blorbo|AWM|very grumpy hill giant}. Hill giants have been known to eat goblins who stray too far from Gob-Town, so only foolish goblins go to Giant's Cave.

But there's another rumor that says long ago a dwarf king went in there to look for a legendary gemstone known as the Eagle's Eye. He never returned from his quest. Goblins have seen dwarves looking for their king, but they have never looked in Giant's Cave, and the goblins are scared of dwarves so no one has told them about their king.
But now Muk has found a {@creature dwarf|AWM} weeping in the Dankwood, she's the king's daughter and she misses her dad. Can Muk and his friends brave the hill giant and maybe find the dwarf king?

entries.name: Questions to ask:
items: How does Muk get past the grumpy hill giant?
Did the Eagle's Eye put the dwarf king into a magical slumber?
Does saving the king make dwarves and goblins friends?

entries.name: Monsters
entries: The following monsters have been simplified/modified to be used in Muk's Adventures. The following stat blocks are for your reference. Feel free to adjust or add in whatever you'd like to customize it to your story.

entries.name: Dankwood Goblins

entries: Ahh the Dankwood goblins! I have adventured far and wide in my time and never have I met such unique and interesting goblins as these. Perhaps it is the magical nature of the Dankwood itself as this forest was once rumored to have been the ancient sanctum of a powerful Netherese wizard, but who is to say? This world is a wondrous one and everywhere you go, something new is there to dazzle and amaze!
Dankwood goblins are much like any other run-of-the-mill goblin but they are much more gentle and artistic than the savage and uncouth goblins of the world.

They are inquisitive and have a magical bond with the small forest creatures with which they are often friends. They are fast and nimble and love to explore. Because of this they make great adventurers and guides.

entries.name: Character Sheets

entries.title: Adventure with Muk: Character Sheets
entries.altText: Adventure with Muk: Character Sheets

entries: Create your {@i own} Dankwood adventurer, or play as one of the goblin heroes!

entries.title: Be a Hero. Play D&D. For Kids.

entries: Obstacles and foes don't stand a chance, if we stand and work together.

to everyone who has supported, encouraged and joined me on this adventure. A very special thank you to Adam Lee, D&D's world architect, who has a talent for finding the good in all things and lighting the way for others.

We can accomplish so much together and I am grateful to see the kindness, laughter and support that is cultivated by the Dungeons & Dragons community. Let's be kind, let's do good and let's tell our stories together.
